009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.util.Random;
014
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
017import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
018import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
022
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
024import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
025import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
026
027/**
028 * Performs an exact ellipse fit to 5 given points. If the fit is unsuccessful,
029 * {@link #getParameters()} returns {@code null}. The underlying algorithm is
030 * described in Section F.3.3 of [1].
031 * <p>
032 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
033 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * @author WB
037 * @version 2022/11/17
038 */
039public class EllipseFit5Points implements EllipseFitAlgebraic {
040        
041        private final double[] p;       // p = (A,B,C,D,E,F) ellipse parameters
042        
043        public EllipseFit5Points(Pnt2d[] points) {
044                this.p = fit(points);
045        }
046
047        @Override
048        public double[] getParameters() {
049                return this.p;
050        }
051        
052        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points) {
053                if (points.length < 5) {
054                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("5 points are needed for " + this.getClass().getSimpleName());
055                }
056                final int n = points.length;
057
058                // create design matrix X:
059                RealMatrix X = new Array2DRowRealMatrix(n, 5);
060                RealVector b = new ArrayRealVector(n);
061                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
062                        double x = points[i].getX();
063                        double y = points[i].getY();
064                        X.setEntry(i, 0, sqr(x) - sqr(y));
065                        X.setEntry(i, 1, x * y);
066                        X.setEntry(i, 2, x);
067                        X.setEntry(i, 3, y);
068                        X.setEntry(i, 4, 1);
069                        b.setEntry(i, - sqr(y));
070                }
071                
072//              System.out.println("X = \n" + Matrix.toString(X));
073//              System.out.println("b = " + Matrix.toString(b));
074                
075                LUDecomposition decomp = new LUDecomposition(X); 
076                // see https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-math/userguide/linear.html
077                 
078                DecompositionSolver solver = decomp.getSolver();
079                RealVector x = null;
080                try {
081                        x = solver.solve(b);
082                } catch(SingularMatrixException e) { }
083
084                if (x == null) {
085                        return null;
086                }
087                
088                double A = x.getEntry(0);
089                double B = x.getEntry(1);
090                double C = 1 - A;
091                double D = x.getEntry(2);
092                double E = x.getEntry(3);
093                double F = x.getEntry(4);
094                
095                boolean isEllipse = (4 * A * C - sqr(B)) > 0;
096                
097                return (isEllipse) ? new double[] {A,B,C,D,E,F} : null;
098        }
099        
100        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
101        
102        public static void main(String[] args) {
103                PrintPrecision.set(9);
104                Pnt2d p0 = Pnt2d.from(40, 53);
105                Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(107, 20);
106                Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(170, 26);
107                Pnt2d p3 = Pnt2d.from(186, 55);
108                Pnt2d p4 = Pnt2d.from(135, 103);
109                
110                Pnt2d[] points = {p0, p1, p2, p3, p4};
111                EllipseFit5Points fit = new EllipseFit5Points(points);
112                System.out.println("fit parameters = " + Matrix.toString(fit.getParameters()));
113                System.out.println("fit ellipse = " + fit.getEllipse());
114                System.out.println("fit ellipse = " +  Matrix.toString(fit.getEllipse().getParameters()));
115                
116                // create random 5-point sets and try to fit ellipses, counting null results:
117                Random rg = new Random(17);
118                int N = 1000;
119                int nullCnt = 0;
120                for (int k = 0; k < N; k++) {
121                        for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
122                                double x = rg.nextInt(200);
123                                double y = rg.nextInt(200);
124                                points[i] = Pnt2d.from(x, y);
125                        }
126                        fit = new EllipseFit5Points(points);
127                        if (fit.getEllipse() == null) {
128                                nullCnt++;
129                        }
130//                      System.out.println("fit ellipse = " + fit.getEllipse());
131                        
132                }
133                
134                System.out.println(nullCnt + " null results out of " + N);
135                
136                // fit ellipse = {0.317325319, 0.332954818, 0.875173557, -89.442594143, -150.574265066, 7886.192568730}
137        }
138}
